Protocols/LCURLRequestSerialization.html.name: LCURLRequestSerialization

Enums/LCCachePolicy.html#/c:@E@LCCachePo.abstract: Query from server and do not save result to the local cache.

Enums/LCCachePolicy.html#/c:@E@LCCachePo.abstract: Only query from server, and save result to the local cache.

Enums/LCCachePolicy.html#/c:@E@LCCachePo.name: kLCCachePolicyCacheElseNetwork
Enums/LCCachePolicy.html#/c:@E@LCCachePo.abstract: Firstly query from the local cache, if fails, query from server.

Enums/LCCachePolicy.html#/c:@E@LCCachePo.name: kLCCachePolicyNetworkElseCache
Enums/LCCachePolicy.html#/c:@E@LCCachePo.abstract: Firstly query from server, if fails, query the local cache.

Classes/LCCompoundResponseSerializer.htm.name: +compoundSerializerWithResponseSerializers:
Classes/LCCompoundResponseSerializer.htm.abstract: Creates and returns a compound serializer comprised of the specified response serializers.

Classes/LCImageResponseSerializer.html#/.name: imageScale
Classes/LCImageResponseSerializer.html#/.abstract: The scale factor used when interpreting the image data to construct responseImage. Specifying a scale factor of 1.0 results in an image whose size matches the pixel-based dimensions of the image. Applying a different scale factor changes the size of the image as reported by the size property. This is set to the value of scale of the main screen by default, which automatically scales images for retina displays, for instance.

Classes/LCImageResponseSerializer.html#/.name: automaticallyInflatesResponseImage
Classes/LCImageResponseSerializer.html#/.abstract: Whether to automatically inflate response image data for compressed formats (such as PNG or JPEG). Enabling this can significantly improve drawing performance on iOS when used with setCompletionBlockWithSuccess:failure:, as it allows a bitmap representation to be constructed in the background rather than on the main thread. YES by default.

A security policy configured with LCSSLPinningModePublicKey or LCSSLPinningModeCertificate can only be applied on a session manager initialized with a secure base URL (i.e. https). Classes/LCCompoundResponseSerializer.htm.name: LCCompoundResponseSerializer

This is useful for supporting multiple potential types and structures of server responses with a single serializer.
